Last but not least, increasing trends of longshore currents and wind waves are expected because global warming and sea surface wind speed increase have been extensively reported
10, 11, 13 and because of the results presented in Fig. 2. For example, Gulev and Grigorieva
12 reported positive trends of significant wave height over the North Pacific with a maximum of 8–10 cm/decade in the northeast Pacific. In addition, increasing water depth due to sea level rise
48, 49 can also result in increased wave height in the intertidal zone
50 .
